wikipedia_page.main: Jim "Spider" Kelly (25 February 1912 – death unknown) born in Derry was an Irish professional feather/light/welter/middleweight boxer of the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s who won the Irish flyweight title, British Boxing Board of Control (BBBofC) Northern Ireland Area featherweight title, BBBofC British featherweight title, and British Empire featherweight title, his professional fighting weight varied from 125+3⁄4 lb (57.0 kg; 8 st 13.8 lb), i.e. Featherweight to 148+1⁄2 lb (67.4 kg; 10 st 8.5 lb), i.e. Middleweight.

response: James, Jimmy or Jim Kelly may refer to:
* Jim Kelly (author) (born 1957), British crime writer and journalist
*Jim Kelly (Kansas politician) (born 1947), member of the Kansas House of Representatives
*Jim Kelly (born 1960), American football Hall of Fame quarterback
*Jim Kelly (tight end, born 1942), American football player
*Jim Kelly (tight end, born 1951), American football player
*Jim Kelly (coach) (1893–1972), American basketball, football, and track and field coach
*Jim Kelly (New Zealand cricketer) (1928–1995), a Wellington representative cricketer in 1951
*Jim Kelly (boxer) (1912–?), Northern Irish boxer of the 1920s, '30s and '40s
*Jim Kelly (martial artist) (1946–2013), karate champion and martial arts film star
* Jim Kelly, managing editor of Time magazine (2001–2005)
* Jim Kelly Peak, a mountain in British Columbia, Canada
